contentrichtext.text: {{Japanese city |Name = Yashio |JapaneseName=八潮市 |Prefecture=[[Saitama Prefecture|Saitama]] |Region=[[Kantō region|Kantō]] |MapImage=Yashio in Saitama Prefecture Ja.svg |Area_km2=18.03 |Population=81,148 |PopDate=2008/11/01 |Density_km2=4501 |Coords = {{coord|35|49|11|N|139|50|32|E|region:JP_type:city}} |Postal code=340-xxxx |LatitudeDegrees= 35 |LatitudeMinutes= 49 |LatitudeSeconds= 11 |LongtitudeDegrees= 139 |LongtitudeMinutes= 50 |LongtitudeSeconds= 32 |Area code= |Mayor = Shigemi Tada (since September 2001) |Tree = [[Ginkgo biloba|Ginkgo]] |Flower = [[Gardenia jasminoides]] |Bird = [[White Wagtail]] |SymbolImage= Flag of Yashio Saitama.JPG |CityHallPostalCode = 340-8588 |CityHallAddress= 1-2-1 Chūō, Yashio-shi, Saitama |CityHallPhone= 048-996-2111 |CityHallLink = [http://www.city.yashio.saitama.jp/ City of Yashio] |CityMap=Yashio in Saitama Prefecture Ja.svg }} {{nihongo|'''Yashio'''|八潮市|Yashio-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] in [[Saitama Prefecture]], Japan. As of 2008, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 81,148 and a [[population density]] of 4,500.7 persons per km². The total area is 18.03 km². The city was founded on January 15, 1972. ==History== * 28 September 1956: The [[Villages of Japan|village]] of Yashio, in Minami-Saitama [[Districts of Japan|District]] was formed by the [[gappei|merger]] of three former villages (Shiodome, Hachijō, and Yahata) * 1 October 1964: The village was [[Municipalities of Japan|promoted]] to [[towns of Japan|town]] status * 15 January 1972: The town became a city * 24 August 2005: The [[Tsukuba Express]] railway line opened, and [[Yashio Station]] became the only railway station to operate in the city. ==External links== {{commons category-inline}} * [http://www.city.yashio.saitama.jp/ Yashio official website] {{ja icon}} {{Saitama}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2011}} [[Category:Cities in Saitama Prefecture]] {{Saitama-geo-stub}}
